title: Support importing vSphere VM list
author: bperel
body_snippet:
vSphere has a feature enabling to save a VM list to a CSV or an XML file.

It would be nice to be able to import this list back into mRemoveNG.
Example of an exported CSV (the columns to export are customizable in vSphere) : 


```
| NAME                | STATE      | STATUS | HOST              | PROVISIONED SPACE | USED SPACE | HOST CPU - MHZ | GUEST OS                               | IP ADDRESS |
|---------------------|------------|--------|-------------------|-------------------|-----...

comments.snippet:
I think is nicer to actually connect to the thing. I might be looking into this.

There you go: [VMware API and SDK Documentation](https://www.vmware.com/support/pubs/sdk_pubs.html)
comments.author: pedro2555

comments.snippet: @pedro2555 - yeah... this would be a nice feature. However since we would have the option to store vCenter credentionals, this type of implementation would have to wait until the develop branch is more stable (as it has a big focus on security).
comments.author: kmscode
